info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued December 13 at 4:16PM CST until December 15 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Very windy, hot, and dry conditions expected Wednesday... .An upper level storm system will move into the Central Plains Wednesday bringing strong southwest winds with it. Many locations may experience wind gusts over 45 mph by Wednesday afternoon, with stronger gusts perhaps exceeding 60 mph across across far northwestern Oklahoma. Well above average temperatures and minimum relative humidity in the mid teens will also be present, resulting in critical to extreme fire weather conditions. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS...LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY...AND DRY FUELS FOR WESTERN AND NORTHWESTERN OKLAHOMA AND HARDEMAN COUNTY TEXAS... * TIMING...Late morning through early evening. * WINDS...Southwest 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 13 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Upper 70s. * IMPACTS...Any fires that start in this environment will become very difficult to control.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
